channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Valve wants Half-Life: Alyx to work well standalone on Steam Frame
item.description: When I tried Half-Life: Alyx streaming from a PC to Valve’s new Steam Frame VR headset, I was blown away; thanks to the Frame’s dedicated wireless adapter and a cool trick Valve calls “foveated streaming,” I didn’t detect any latency as I explored an industrial building and fought some head crabs. But the Frame also […]

item.title: Evacuation Warnings Issued as Atmospheric River Threatens to Drench Burn-Scarred Los Angeles
item.description: The storm could trigger dangerous flash floods and mudslides, but it may also extinguish California’s wildfire season.

item.title: Apple adjusts to the rise of the mini app with better reporting and lower commissions – and you might be the benefactor
item.description: Apple has updated how it handles mini apps with a new App Store Mini Apps Partner Program that may improve the experience and lead to cheaper in-mini-app purchases.

item.title: Baidu unveils proprietary ERNIE 5 beating GPT-5 performance on charts, document understanding and more
item.description: Mere hours after OpenAI updated its flagship foundation model GPT-5 to GPT-5.1, promising reduced token usage overall and a more pleasant personality with more preset options, Chinese search giant Baidu unveiled its next-generation foundation model, ERNIE 5.0, alongside a suite of AI product upgrades and strategic international expansions.The goal: to position as a global contender in the increasingly competitive enterprise AI market.Announced at the company's Baidu World 2025 event, ERNIE 5.0 is a proprietary, natively omni-modal model designed to jointly process and generate content across t...

item.title: Deaf Tesla Employee Fired After Complaining Factory’s Heat Disabled Hearing Aids, Lawsuit Claims
item.description: The litigation claims that the company failed to adhere to federal regulations for people with disabilities.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein Claimed Intimate Knowledge of Donald Trump’s Views in Texts With Bill Gates Adviser
item.description: In text messages from 2017, Jeffrey Epstein seemingly represented himself as positioned to pass information from the Trump White House to Bill Gates through an intermediary.

item.title: Black Friday comes early for printing fans: Elegoo's Centauri Carbon 3D printer is now just $279
item.description: The Elegoo Centauri Carbon is a budget 3D printer priced at just $279.99 this Black Friday.

item.title: Tesla Recalls Powerwall 2 Units After Fires and Property Damage
item.description: The recalled units were installed between Nov. 2020 and Dec. 2022.

item.title: Christopher Nolan Explains Why He Wanted to Make ‘The Odyssey’
item.description: The 'Dark Knight' and 'Inception' director wants his 2026 release to be an epic on a scale Hollywood has never seen.

item.title: The 45 Best Movies on Hulu, WIRED's Picks (November 2025)
item.description: Sovereign, The Rocky Horror Picture Show, and Love Actually are just a few of the movies you need to watch on Hulu right now.

item.title: Anthropic details how it measures Claude’s wokeness
item.description: Anthropic is detailing its efforts to make its Claude AI chatbot “politically even-handed” — a move that comes just months after President Donald Trump issued a ban on “woke AI.” As outlined in a new blog post, Anthropic says it wants Claude to “treat opposing political viewpoints with equal depth, engagement, and quality of analysis.” […]

item.title: I tested these officially licensed earbuds for Nintendo Switch 2 – are they really worth buying?
item.description: Looking to buy cheap earbuds for your Nintendo Switch 2? I tried this officially licensed set and they weren’t half bad.

item.title: Google permettra finalement l’installation d’applications non vérifiées sur Android, à une condition
item.description: Google voulait rendre l'installation d'applications Android de développeurs non certifiés totalement impossible, mais certains pourront quand même le faire.

item.title: Apple will take a mini commission from mini app developers
item.description: Apple is launching a new program for mini app developers that slashes its fees for in-app purchases. On Thursday, the company announced that mini app creators who join the program take advantage of a lower 15 percent commission rate — half of the up to 30 percent rate Apple charges other developers. Apple describes mini […]

item.title: The ‘Big Short’ Guy Shuts Down Hedge Fund Amid AI Bubble Fears
item.description: "Sometimes, the only winning move is not to play."

item.title: Buying a new camera phone this Black Friday? Megapixels aren’t the only important spec
item.description: If you’re looking for a new camera phone during sales season, resolution isn’t the only thing you should keep an eye out for on the spec sheet

item.title: Save $150 on the incredible Dyson Supersonic Hair Dryer this Black Friday
item.description: The Dyson Supersonic Hair Dryer is slightly older tech, but it's still one of the best hair dryers around – and now it's got a big price cut for Black Friday.

item.title: Hackers use Anthropic’s AI model Claude once again
item.description: Anthropic announced on Thursday that Chinese state-backed hackers used the company’s AI model Claude to automate roughly 30 attacks on corporations and governments during a September campaign, according to reporting from the Wall Street Journal. Anthropic said that up to 80% to 90% of the attack was automated with AI, a level higher than previous […]...

item.title: Who is buying VR and XR headsets anyway?
item.description: From the outside, it looks like virtual and mixed reality is having a moment. Three new headsets have launched or been announced in the last month: There's Apple's M5 Vision Pro, the Samsung Galaxy XR, and, just this week, Valve announced the Steam Frame. Given the marketing, you might assume that means Big Tech thinks […]

item.title: This Is the First Extinct Species Ever Found in Fossilized Barf—and It’s a Pterosaur
item.description: For decades, researchers believed they were looking at fish remains. They were way off the mark.

item.title: I discovered 3 criminally underused VPN features – and they're all on sale right now!
item.description: These VPNs can do more than you think, and few people realise!

item.title: Uber’s newest button takes you somewhere surprising
item.description: A seasonal feature hidden inside the app now whisks riders to more than 40 mountains across the U.S. and Europe. The headache of planning a ski trip stands in sharp contrast to the freedom of effortlessly slicing down the slopes once you actually get up the mountain.

item.title: Now that's a bonus - top camera company gifts solid gold keycaps worth thousands of dollars to its top employees
item.description: Insta360’s lavish gold keycap rewards reflect a growing culture of luxury that blurs the line between motivation and marketing.

item.title: The New Apple Watch Ultra 3 Is $100 Off
item.description: You could save big on Apple's most recently released and most powerful wrist hardware.

item.title: Uber quietly pilots in-app video recording for drivers in India
item.description: Uber's in-app video recording pilot is currently live in 10 cities across India.

item.title: The best phone to buy right now
item.description: Editor’s note: Black Friday doesn’t officially take place until Friday, November 28th; however, if you want to shop ahead of time, we’ve rounded up the best early Black Friday deals you can already get. Haven’t you heard? Phones are boring now. And that’s just fine! Most people buying a new phone just want something familiar that works better […]

item.title: Les astronomes pensaient connaître les Pléiades : une étude révèle qu’elles sont 20 fois plus grandes qu’on ne l’imaginait !
item.description: Les Pléiades fascinent Homo sapiens depuis l'Antiquité sur la voûte céleste et encore plus depuis que les télescopes en fournissent des photographies en couleur. Mais cet amas d'étoiles n'a pas encore livré tous ses secrets, comme le prouve une découverte récente.

item.title: 6 Stephen King Movies We’d Love to See Remade
item.description: Edgar Wright's 'Running Man' is now in theaters, so are there other King movies that could use a remake?

item.title: The last-gen Apple Watch Series 10 has returned to its lowest price to date
item.description: The Apple Watch Series 11 is only a few months old, so discounts have been hard to come by thus far. However, if you don’t need the latest tech, the Apple Watch Series 10 delivers nearly the same experience, and the 42mm base model is currently down to an all-time low of $279 ($120 off) […]

item.title: Where have all the TV cameras gone?
item.description: This is Lowpass by Janko Roettgers, a newsletter on the ever-evolving intersection of tech and entertainment, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Earlier this month, the UK's Comcast-owned pay TV operator Sky announced plans to pull the plug on one of its more ambitious hardware initiatives: Sky Live, a smart camera accessory […]

item.title: Netflix is turning its biggest shows into daily puzzle games
item.description: Netflix is getting into the daily puzzle games trend in a big new way. As part of a bunch of games announcements, the company revealed it would be releasing a new daily puzzle games app called Netflix Puzzled that will feature a bunch of puzzles themed around Netflix’s biggest franchises. “Get ready for a plethora […]

item.title: Netflix’s new era of TV games starts now
item.description: Netflix's next stab at gaming is here. Starting today you'll be able to play a number of multiplayer party games on your TV using your phone as a controller. To start, Netflix is offering Boggle Party, Party Crasher: Fool Your Friends, Lego Party, Pictionary: Game Night, and Tetris Time Warp. A social deduction game based […]

item.title: From Barbie to Coach: Adobe is reinventing design with AI
item.description: Adobe’s agentic AI tools are turbocharging brand creativity, leading to fast, collaborative, and deeply human campaigns. For decades, Adobe’s software tools, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, have been the universal language of visual communication, shaping how marketers, artists, and brands build the modern creative world. As artificial intelligence transforms the nature of work and how we define productivity, the 42-year-old creative tech company is reinventing itself once again, transforming the world’s creative supply chains through its AI ecosystem. ...

item.title: Verizon to cut about 15,000 jobs as it restructures under new CEO
item.description: The company’s largest-ever layoffs, affecting about 15% of its workforce, could take place as soon as next week. Verizon is planning to cut about 15,000 jobs in the telecommunications company’s largest-ever layoffs as part of a restructuring under its new CEO, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

item.title: Newsletter platform beehiiv adds AI website building, creator tools in major expansion
item.description: Newsletter platform beehiiv announced a massive expansion to its platform on Thursday, including offering real-time analytics and AI website creation.

item.title: People With Long Covid Have This Freaky-Looking Thing in Their Blood
item.description: The finding could help scientists better identify and potentially treat these complex cases.
